attributes.action: Completely Scrap Stamp Duty, we pay enough taxes!
attributes.background: Stamp Duty should be scraped, we pay enough already in taxes and scraping Stamp Duty will help people to afford to buy a property

attributes.action: Get NHS backing for MAP vaccine for Crohn's disease and colitis cure
attributes.background: I am a Crohn's disease and colitis sufferer. Life is very difficult because there is no cure. There is a possible cure at the Kings college hospital. The trials cannot go ahead because there is not enough funding. Meanwhile IBD sufferers have to struggle with life. This vaccine could help cure IBD
attributes.additional_details: There are 250,000 people in the UK that suffer from IBD, over 80% need to have surgery to correct or remove the colon. It is a chronic disease which is debilitating. Prof. John. Hermon - Taylor has worked out that a bacteria found in cattle is transferred to humans with a weak immune system. I have to have lots of medication to get through each day and have been hospitalised because I cannot get a remission. Crohn's and colitis sufferers are desperate for a cure. The vaccine is ready to test

attributes.action: Protect the public sector from future Private Finance Initiatives (PFI)
attributes.background: PFI’s charge on average 15% interest pa for 30 years. We propose that all future public sector infrastructure projects should be paid for through Public Finance Initiative Bonds (PFIB’s) where members of the general public could invest via the post office into PFIB’s in return for a 5% interest p.a.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS is currently paying £3,729 every minute to private companies as part of an annual repayment fee for building and operating new hospitals or redeveloping old ones.
PFIBs could replace PFIs and be similar to National savings bonds where the general public deposit money (say a minimum £1,000 for a minimum of 5 years) via the post office into a PFIB this would be used to build future public infrastructure projects. Even allowing for 5% operating costs this would reduce our costs by over 25%

attributes.action: No fees for parents who wish to know info about their kids from social services
attributes.background: When couples separate, it's very difficult to iron out the terms when it comes to children and many end up in court. For a non residential parent, they must apply for information from social services and then pay a fee to get written information. None can be given by phone
attributes.additional_details: Bromley Council was contacted by a father to ask what is happening with he's daughter, as court cafcass reports stated problems with the health and education of he's child.  Social services said he must apply for freedom of information by form on their website. The letter he recieved back stated he needs to pay £10 fee plus obtain documents such as birth certificate for he's child. The mother has this so he also has to buy he's own at a cost. This info should be free once ID or rights proven

attributes.action: NO guarantee for EU nationals in UK without equality for Brits in EU.
attributes.background: Brits were encouraged for 30 years to invest in EU by buying houses for their retirement in a favourable climate for their health. Is it the wish of the British people for over a million UK pensioners to lose everything they have worked for all their lives?

attributes.action: Rejecting Brexit - find a better alternative to leaving the EU.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to refrain from invoking Article 50. Instead we call upon you to work with the other 27 EU members to find a solution to the issues associated with the free movement of people throughout the EU and, if necessary, to subsequently hold a second EU referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
A key issue for many who voted to leave the EU is unlimited migration of EU citizens into the UK. The issue of migration within the EU impacts countries beyond the UK and must be addressed by the EU as a whole to prevent further countries voting to leave.

If the UK were to leave the EU around half the UK population would still be left dissatisfied. By contrast, we believe that the UK remaining in a reformed EU could satisfy a significantly larger majority of the UK population.

attributes.action: Lets Join The Nordic Alliance. Post Brexit
attributes.background: Iceland wants the UK to join Nordic alliance, and I do too! Not only is the Nordic alliance built from some of the most amazing coolest countries on the planet, we are also very closely linked in our customs and our history.
attributes.additional_details:
Iceland wants the UK to join Nordic alliance, and I do too! Not only is the Nordic alliance built from some of the most amazing coolest countries on the planet, we are also very closely linked in our customs and our history.

"When Britain leaves the EU, we will see a triangle that covers a large part of the globe: Greenland, Iceland, the Faroe Islands, Norway - and now the United Kingdom,” said Iceland’s President Olafur Ragnar Grimsson

attributes.action: Add an option for "Protest / No Confidence" to all ballot voting options.
attributes.background: Rather than depending on spoiled ballot papers to count protest votes, introduce an official way for the voting public to express their democratic right to show that they have a political opinion, but they disagree with all the views of a campaign or political parties.
attributes.additional_details: There is a large number of the voting public who feel disenfranchised by our political parties and representatives, who feel like they have no representive or political voice. Spoiled ballot papers are not always clearly counted, and in the case of a referendum can be ignored completely. Having a specific option that allows the voting public to voice their desire to be involved, but that they are excluded from the current political parties, leaders or campaigns is essential for democracy.

attributes.action: A tenant should not be evicted, after expiry of the tenancy without any reason.
attributes.background: A tenant usually sign tenancy agreement for 12 months, but after the expiry of the tenancy agreement, landlord issues him 2 month's Section 21 Notice and evict him by county court order. This destroys the family life of the tenant. He needs to struggle again to establish a normal family life.

attributes.action: To establish a new bank holiday for the UK to be named "UK Diversity Day".
attributes.background: This day should be celebrated across the UK celebrating the contribution of the many diverse groups across a number of strands of UK society including Age, Disability, Gender, LGBT, Race and Religion. We are a great nation with a great history of embracing diversity and we should celebrate that.

attributes.action: Make MP's like us: 93% state school; 50% women; 100% from their constituency.
attributes.background: The country is economically and politically divided. MP's are bewildered by those outside London because they are so different from them. Let's break the domination of private school educated, London based men in our politics. Bring in quotas now for our representatives so MP's look like us.
attributes.additional_details:
50% of the population are women. Women got the vote a hundred years ago and still they are under represented and under paid in every walk of life.
7% of the population are private school educated and yet they make up to 50% of MP's in government. 
Career politicians live and work in London and do not understand the people they represent. 
These three problems can be solved by the next General Election. Let's make MP's more like us and bring in quotas for a fairer, less divided, United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Bring in informed consent legislation for elections and referendums.
attributes.background: It is currently legal for political bodies to use false or misleading information in the run up to a vote. Introducing Free, Prior, Informed Consent(FPIC) legislation for elections would hold politicians accountable for misleading or manipulating voters as well as make sure people are aware of risks
attributes.additional_details: Many voters have said they did not fully understand the EU referendum. Politicians used false figures and misleading information in official campaigns to manipulate voters’ decisions. This impinges on voters’ right to self-determination, because they were not fully informed. There is legislation to protect the same rights in other professions, there should also be similar ones for politics and government.

attributes.action: Make an application for EU membership no later than 1 year after leaving the EU
attributes.background:
Many people who voted to leave the European Union in the June 2016 referendum have changed their minds and a clear message that EU reform is needed has been sent and, we hope, received. 
We wish, in the interests of unity and prosperity, to reclaim the UK's place in the EU.

attributes.action: A highly experienced business figure should lead UK exit negotiations with EU
attributes.background: Given the extreme importance of negotiating the best possible exit for the UK from the EU, the government should employ the services of a highly experienced, independent business figure to lead & manage the negotiations. We need the best person for the job who is unlikely to be a politician.

attributes.action: Make it legal to listen to broadcasts not meant for the general public. (ATC)
attributes.background: It is illegal to provide air traffic control feeds from within the UK due to an outdated law that originated in 1942. The law states that although it is not illegal to sell, buy or own a scanning receiver in the UK, it must only be used to listen to transmissions meant to be broadcast to the public.
attributes.additional_details:
OfCom (the U.K. regulatory authority for communications) has stated on numerous occasions: "It is an offence to listen to any other radio services unless you are authorised by a designated person to do so." 

This means that it is illegal to listen to anything other than general reception. This is clearly a law that needs to be updated in light of the many educational uses for listening to aircraft communications. Furthermore, the original reasons for this law have long since become irrelevant.

attributes.action: Greater devolution of powers to Greater London - like Scotland, NI and Wales
attributes.background: Considering the size of London's population and the unique challenges it faces, London should have a similar say in these matters, with further powers devolved to the London Assembly and London given more control over its finances to focus on its own priorities.
attributes.additional_details:
Greater London is economically and socially distinct from England. We know this from recent polls and elections.

Areas with smaller populations and economies (London's being larger than many European nations) have gained powers through devolution, e.g. the Northern Ireland Assembly, Scottish Parliament and National Assembly of Wales. They are responsible for areas such as infrastructure, health and education as these countries are best suited to make their own decisions within their borders.

attributes.action: Let EU immigrants know what the plans are regarding their future in the UK
attributes.background:
Millions of EU citizens have been working in the UK for many years, many children were born in the UK from EU citizens, and as such, see Britain as their home as they grew up here and were taught the same values as all other British Children.
What conditions can you provide for them after Brexit?
attributes.additional_details:
Let EU immigrants know what the plans are regarding their future in the UK - immediately and without delay!

These families are all currently experiencing uncertainty and fear. Let them know what they can expect from the Government and don't keep them in the dark. They didn't have the right to vote in the Referendum, but they do have the right to know what will happen to their families, workplaces, mortgages, student loans and education, as well as safety and welfare.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to hold a second BREXIT referendum until 2036.
attributes.background: A referendum has already been held, and democracy is not about taking a second vote if you aren't happy with the first.

attributes.action: Restore the historic boundary of Warwickshire.
attributes.background:
In 1974 the county of Warwickshire was broken up to make the fictitious region of West Midlands.
The local government act 1972 change Warwickshire's boundaries and took out the major cities.
Birmingham, Coventry, Edgbaston, Solihull, Sutton Coldfield and other area's should be returned.
attributes.additional_details: Edgbaston is the home of Warwickshire county cricket club.

attributes.action: Rerun the EU referendum with compulsory voting and reduce the voting age to 16.
attributes.background: The decision to leave or remain in the EU is one that will affect every person in this country. As such this decision requires agreement from every single member of the population to ensure that we make the right choice. This includes those aged 16 -17 who were allowed their say in similar referenda
attributes.additional_details: The recent EU referendum discriminates against the youth based on the precedent of being allowed to vote at 16+ in the Scottish Referendum. There are also those who did not vote in the recent referendum who may now wish to add their voice to whether to remain or leave the EU. Considering the closeness of the result. A compulsory vote of all citizens aged 16+ is required to settle this issue once and for all with full agreement of the population as its implications affects all citizens.

attributes.action: Create a TV advert explaining to people who voted remain how democracy works.
attributes.background: It has become clear since the referendum result was announced that a significant number of the population do not understand how the democratic process works. This is an issue which a skilfully crafted TV advert will help to address.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement to hold a UK Election within a year of any change of PM
attributes.background: New PM'S should have a mandate from the people they govern, rather than a few party members.  As such a new UK GENERAL Election should be held within 1 year of a new PM being appointed so he or she can claim to lead the People as PM with a proper mandate.

attributes.action: Change how the UK is governed to better serve and protect the British public.
attributes.background: Currently the key decision makers in the UK in the House of Lords are un-elected. They are appointed by being vetted by the Appointments Commission, then approved by the prime minister and formalised by the Queen. We feel that all aspects of our Government, especially key members should be elected.
attributes.additional_details:
We demand that:

All members of the House of Lords are appointed by the public's vote only and each members term is subjected to a vote every 5 years.

If voted out, their position is to be replaced by a member elected by public vote.

Membership is to open to all current and former MP's.
 
If a MP is currently serving when elected to the House of Lords, their local position is to be replaced by a member of their own party. This member is to be elected by the people in their constituency only.

attributes.action: Increase NHS and science research funding by £350 million per week
attributes.background: The leave campaign promised to redirect the money spent on EU membership to UK priorities, such as NHS and science funding. They should honour this promise, and increase funding for the NHS and science research by £350 million per week, which is what is spent by the UK on EU membership.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.voteleavetakecontrol.org/campaign - evidence that voters were promised increased funding for the NHS and science research by the leave campaign.

attributes.action: Work with the Commonwealth of Nations to establish an economic union
attributes.background: We call upon Her Majesty, the government and the British Parliament to actively seek cooperation with other commonwealth countries to establish a strong union/community that promotes greater social, political & economic harmony amongst those countries we have a strong historical relationships with.
attributes.additional_details: The people of the UK have voted to leave the EU, which will cause a huge economic impact. This vote is influenced by strong concerns regarding the legitimacy of a democratic mandate within the European Commission. There are also many constitutional questions this raises in terms of future arrangements between nations within the UK such as Scottish autonomy & Northern Ireland's relationship with Ireland. Commonwealth countries have already endorsed seeking free trade between commonwealth members.

attributes.action: Set a date for a Scotland independence referendum
attributes.background: The U.K. Eu referendum result is not supported by the majority in Scotland. A further referendum should be run to determine if Scotland wishes to remain in Europe.

attributes.action: Remove the 'triple lock' on pensions and protect the NHS from further cuts
attributes.background: Over 70% of pensioners backed the Leave vote to force Britain out of the EU and likely into a recession. The taxpayer pays more for pensions, than for healthcare, but unlike health the 'triple lock' on pensions guarantees increases of at least 2.5%, inflation or average earnings, whichever is higher
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015, £150bn was spent of taxpayer money on pensioners who voted to leave the EU. This looks certain to mean another recession and another round of austerity. The NHS can't take any more cuts, we were told during the referendum, so let's protect healthcare spending and cut pensions for those who clearly think we can afford a recession.
http://www.ukpublicspending.co.uk/budget_pie_ukgs.php

attributes.action: For EU motions to be urgently debated in Parliament offering a range of outcomes
attributes.background: Next steps for Parliament is far from clear or defined in law. An urgent Commons debate should offer a range of motions from each side of the campaign with full analysis of issues and offering a range of options moving forward. Any parliamentary outcome should be accompanied by wider consultation.

attributes.action: The Government to ensure EU funding is replaced on a like-for-like basis.
attributes.background:
A large number of projects across a wide field of endeavor, including such diverse things as scientific research and urban regeneration, are currently funded by the EU. As the UK disengages itself from the EU this funding will be withdrawn.
This could lead to many vital projects being abandoned.

attributes.action: Call for an enquiry into false claims & advertising used in the EU Referendum
attributes.background: Both sides used false advertising and claims during the EU Referendum. It made for a completely confusing debate and made it extremely hard for the electorate to follow, and therefore tough to make an informed decision.

attributes.action: Have a serious debate regarding Capital Punishment for murder
attributes.background: This is not a knee jerk reaction to the appalling events in Birstall yesterday but more a reaction to the ease with taking a life has become acceptable, Capital Punishment would hopefully make some people think twice before ending a person's life.
attributes.additional_details: The progress with DNA testing must make it unlikely any one innocent of a crime would be punished in erroras,  I know happened in the past.

attributes.action: Decrease length of employment time needed to qualify for paternity leave.
attributes.background: I hadn't realised until recently how poor paternity rights in this country are. It is unfair and ridiculous that a man needs to have worked 26 weeks, 15 weeks before the due date, at a company in order to simply qualify for 1 week off work to spend time with his child and the mother.
attributes.additional_details: This is completely disproportionate to the amount of time the father gets off work. It is an important time for both parents as they bond with their child, and indeed a difficult time as they both learn to be parents. It is against every idea of fairness and equality, British values, that fathers do not automatically qualify for at least 1 week for paternity. The length of time they have to have worked there simply must be reduced, and for that matter they should be able to apply for more.

attributes.action: Free swimming concessions for elderly on a national basis.
attributes.background: To increase health and activity of older population at all public pools . Older people have limited income so free swimming would encourage healthier lifestyle.  Pools are paid out of council tax so should benifit local elderly .

attributes.action: Force credit/debit card providers allow a customer block on contactless payments
attributes.background: Contactless payments are a security risk. They permit criminals to collect users data using unauthorised scanners, the "Contactless Infusion X5" being sold by "CC Buddies" for £500, is just one of them.
attributes.additional_details:
Please see the following recent Daily Star article:-

http://www.dailystar.co.uk/news/latest-news/522417/Fraud-clone-bank-cards-contactless-device

attributes.action: Make the government increase funds to support youth mental health.
attributes.background:
Due to national bed shortages in mental health units, many young people have been forced to move over 200 miles away from home, leaving loved ones behind.

0.6% of the NHS budget goes into helping young people with mental health, this is not enough.

attributes.action: Force childcare providers to cap escalating and over priced childcare costs
attributes.background: Since my son has been in private nursery, we have paid £14000. My son has been in nursery for 13 months! Over the course of two years, we would have paid £25000 which is enough for a deposit on a house. This is obscene and believe that childcare should be capped to no more than £45 per day.
attributes.additional_details: Not only do parents have to pay for bank holidays but also for family holidays making it near impossible to go on holiday for some families. Many parents earn nothing after paying childcare fees but yet we are urged to work. With some childcare providers charging in excess of £90 per day, how are we supposed to pay these costs?

attributes.action: Stop the winding down of mobile Blood Donor Units nationally
attributes.background: Which is believed to be policy by end of 2016
attributes.additional_details: Blood is given freely and is a needed resource for our medical services, if this policy goes ahead I am sure that the numbers of donors will reduce dramatically, which could effect many lives

attributes.action: Make solar renewable energy a government-led initiative
attributes.background: While it has been often argued that the United Kingdom is a leader in the field of renewable energy, this has primarily been accomplished by the actions of private British businesses and not the actions of the government. It is most certainly time for the government to take its place in the sun.
attributes.additional_details: It is our goal, as it should be the goal of every person both of and on these islands and elsewhere on this planet, to protect it for future generations. There is no doubt in the minds of scientists that a future including humans must be a future of renewable and clean energy. We therefore recommend that the government require all of its properties, and those owned by its representatives of the people of both the upper and lower chambers, to, within a period of five years, possess solar panels.

attributes.action: Send aid and health trained volunteers into Aleppo to help with current crisis.
attributes.background: Aleppo deserves help, we have already turned our backs once before by making it clear England doesn't want refugees, bombing needs to stop. There is no hospitals left. It's a human rights violation. send them aid- medicine, shelter, food, drink, clothes and volunteers trained in health care
attributes.additional_details: Every single day people are dying in Aleppo. Watch the news

attributes.action: hold referendum on ending public financing of the royal family.
attributes.background: redecorating Buckingham palace will cost the taxpayer 367 million pounds, why isn't this very wealthy family responsible for the maintenance of the properties they live in? A referendum should be held for us to decide if they should continue to receive any finance from British taxpayers.

attributes.action: Stop phone  calling. Make it illegal to withhold a company phone number.
attributes.background: Anonymous phone calls, often 10 a day are causing great distress to many people especially the elderly. The telephone preference service does not work; companies either ignore it or say that we contacted them or showed interest when we did not. They are an unacceptable nuisance.

attributes.action: NHS - Give more support to Young Adults
attributes.background: It is extremely worrying & stressful for anyone going to hospital, it is even worse for any young adult (aged 16-20) as whenever you go to clinic, operation or getting a referral done it is extremely difficult, as no one knows where to put you as technically you are too old for children's, but...
attributes.additional_details: ... but are also too young to be in the adults. This is worse when you become an inpatient and they don't know which ward to put you on, and neither is ideal. You spend long periods of uncertainty being passed from departments and you are just waiting for someone to give you the help & support you desperately need. This is a petition for the NHS to give more support and structure within the NHS for Young Adults, (one way do to this would be to introduce specific young adult clinics and wards)

attributes.action: Require the Cabinet ministers to have experience relevant to their roles.
attributes.background: In most public sector jobs the relevant Cabinet minister has little/no experience actually doing any of the jobs they oversee. It would give them more credibility if they have done the jobs in the sector that they're responsible for. eg.The minister for health should have worked in healthcare.

attributes.action: Require all universities by law to consider applications anonymously.
attributes.background: Recent studies have shown that perfectly able candidates are not being offered the same opportunities due to 'name discrimination'. This can be in the form of prejudice surrounding names related to ethnic origin or even gender discrimination within big companies that would like more male employees.
attributes.additional_details:
-Dr. Colin Holbrook, a research scientist at the UCLA Center for Behavior, Evolution, and Culture has recently done a study showing that names have an influence on job interviews and university places in terms of race and gender.
-By making it law for organisations such as UCAS to require anonymous applications it will hopefully prevent discrimination against those with ethnic-sounding or just clear gender identifiable names, based on stereotypes.

attributes.action: 1p and 2p coins should be removed from circulation (cash transactions only)
attributes.background:
We the undersigned want to see the 1p and 2p pieces removed from circulation, since they are no longer of a useful value.

Over time, due to inflation, the value of a coin decreases. The one and two penny pieces are now worth so little that we cannot buy anything useful with them.
attributes.additional_details:
It is important to clarify that this petition is not asking for ALL transactions to be rounded to the nearest 5p. This petition only applies to cash. It calls for removal of 1p and 2p coins, therefore any cash transaction would result in change given rounded to the nearest 5p.

Examples
- If I were to use cash to buy a bottle of milk costing 99p, I would receive no change, since 1p rounds down to zero.

- If I were to buy a cake costing 96p, I would receive 5p change, because 4p rounds up to 5p.

attributes.action: England : have a referendum to leave the U.k. thus leaving the EU automatically
attributes.background:
As the UK is a political entity within the EU. If England would vote to leave the U.K. Then England would automatically become its own country outside the UK and the EU. No article 50 needed. No negotiations beforehand. 

The Scottish referendum made this clear to any country that leaves the U.K.

attributes.action: Move the Ministry for Exiting the EU to Northern England
attributes.background: It is important that the ministry has a good appreciation of the needs of the economy outside the S.E. of England where a great deal of the regeneration and products produced for export come from. It would help in the building confidence in and reinforcing the Northern Powerhouse.
attributes.additional_details: The re-balancing of the economy will be an important component of restructuring the economy after Brexit, the industrial areas of the north had traditionally been part of the successful rise of Britain as a global superpower.

attributes.action: Ban the use of driverless cars before it's too late.
attributes.background: They are danger to other road users. An absurd idea and will cause the death of many pedestrians that could of been avoided. If you don't want to drive then get a taxi. They are not safe for anyone other than the passenger.

attributes.action: Make it law to carry a breakdown warning triangle in every motor vehicle.
attributes.background: If a warning triangle is displayed 100 metres behind a broken down vehicle, it will decrease the chances of someone else crashing into it. What if you had broken down somewhere awkward like a roundabout or a bridge without a hard shoulder?
attributes.additional_details:
It is already mandatory in France to carry a warning triangle.

It alerts other road users to a breakdown so they have enough time to react.

It is very effective on motorways where there is no hard shoulder.

It is known to reduce the amount of accidents involving broken down vehicles.

attributes.action: Make it law that animals microchips come with a tracking device
attributes.background: Get these dogs and cats safe by having a microchip with a tracker in it and then people can locate their pets when they go missing
